isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - ADJUSTMENT OF NEW ELECTRIC SHUT-OFF SOLENOID FOR PES6A INJECTION PUMP

svcproc.title: ADJUSTMENT OF NEW ELECTRIC SHUT-OFF SOLENOID FOR PES6A INJECTION PUMP

note.para: The adjustment procedure must be completed as specified to prevent solenoid burn-out or internal damage to the injection pump.

step1.para: Energize the solenoid by turning the ignition key to the "ON" or "RUN" position. ( RUN position for those vehicles equipped with push-button start).

note.para: The solenoid plunger will not depress when energized.

step1.para: Manually depress the plunger to the bottom (rear) of its travel.
While holding the plunger in, move the shut-off lever toward the RUN position and screw the solenoid swivel (with stud) into the rod end until the shut-off lever stops its forward movement.
Turn the swivel TWO FULL TURNS in the opposite direction. This moves the shut-off lever back towards the shut-off position.
Tighten jam nut, then de-energize the solenoid.

Cycle the solenoid 2-3 times making sure the shut-off lever travel is adequate to achieve the "RUN" and "SHUT-OFF" positions. This can be done by cranking the engine to activate the "PULL" coil causing the plunger to depress and turn the ignition off allowing the plunger to return under spring load.

caution.para: DO NOT CYCLE MORE THAN 3 TIMES WITHIN ONE MINUTE. ADDITIONAL CYCLING MAY CAUSE PULL-IN COIL OVERHEATING RESULTING IN BURNOUT.

step1.para: Secure wire and harnesses with strap locks to make sure that they will not interfere with solenoid operation or rub injection piping.
